name: conference

conference noun [C]
(MEETING)

B1 an event, sometimes lasting a few days, at which there is a group of talks on a particular subject, or a meeting in which especially business matters are discussed formally: a conference on women's rights They frequently hold conferences at that hotel. I'm speaking at/attending a conference next week. Should I book the conference room for the meeting? Compare

conference noun [C]
(SPORTS)
a group of sports teams that play each other in organized competitions: They can win because they have the most talent in their conference. He guided the team to the Southern Conference championship.
More examplesFewer examplesThis year's ACC may be the strongest conference since the '84–'85 Big East. The Canadian prime minister congratulated the Calgary Flames on their victory in the Western Conference finals. Their most formidable opponent would appear to be the Falcons, whom they wouldn't face until the conference championship game.His performance earned him North Central Conference player of the week honours for the third consecutive time this season.
